Articles.Content:
I had started a post in the Technical Questions section, and in one of the answers the following happened:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ Thrust me, I have dealt with this myself in the past...

With that in mind, what can you come up with?

Try to keep the innuendo family friendly?
As I've said in the original thread: 'That's what happens when English isn't your first language and your spell checker doesn't see anything wrong.'

Whenever I'm typing, I generally write "rock" as "rocket." I was doing a paper once on a certain musical genre, and I found two places where I had accidentally written "Rocket-and-Roll," completely without knowing it.

Your signature is wonderful, by the way. Pan Galactic Gargle Blasters FTW!

As I've said in the original thread: 'That's what happens when English isn't your first language and your spell checker doesn't see anything wrong.'

Most great things come from mistakes and misunderstandings. Be it science, evolution, etcÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

This thread is meant as an homage to your (and everyone else's) slip up, and believe me I admire those who are brave/intelligent enough to speak multiple languages. I hack my way through French and Dutch, and can order a beer in a few other languages but I could never post intelligibly on a foreign forum!
Any one speak Klingon?

Any one speak Klingon?

HIja'. loQ vIjatlhlaH.

HIja'. loQ vIjatlhlaH.

Is that seriously Klingon? What does it translate to?

Is that seriously Klingon? What does it translate to?

According to Bing Translate (yes, it has Klingon, but google translate doesn't), "I do. I speak a little."
My, what a giant pe... ROCKET! I WAS ABOUT TO SAY ROCKET >.>

My, what a giant pe... ROCKET! I WAS ABOUT TO SAY ROCKET >.>

I laughed so long and hard when all of a sudden Johnsen Kerman became a part of my roster.

Look, up there, isn't that a bigÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

Johnsen!
I don't have a Freudian slip to add, per se, but my wife has commented on a couple of my launch vehicles with two radial tanks that (unintentionally, mind you) made the whole rocket look phallic.

One time, I was excitedly showing my sister my heavy launch vehicle, and all she could say was:

"It looks like a bunch of cigarettes strapped together!"

(She was right. )

Oh, and also when I launched into yet another impassioned lecture on rocket science to my friends, but this time they were prepared: "hah!! Thrust!!") :( :(

Edited December 12, 2014 by Ikaneko
There's always the one where you say "Mun" instead of "Moon", or "Jool" instead of "Jupiter".
Saying LKO instead of LEO - this is going to ruin a job interview later in life, I bet.
Well, there's an idea for the Kerbal god of Rocketry: All hail Thrust, the mighty ruler of rockets!

Is that seriously Klingon? What does it translate to?

Lol yeah! I couldn't resist.

There's always the one where you say "Mun" instead of "Moon", or "Jool" instead of "Jupiter".

I've done this.... thankfully the person I was talking to was a KSP'r and had a good laugh.
Now I'm scared this might happen to me...
Yeah, I've had that happen a decouple of times.

Is that seriously Klingon? What does it translate to?

taH pagh taHbe'

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RF0k4qV1I1Y
Dang.. I've missed Ike's pe.. Periapsis!

I guess none of these will ever be quite as classic as the RL ones though, like:

"Wow, up close Uranus is just HUGE!"

Saying LKO instead of LEO - this is going to ruin a job interview later in life, I bet.

Every. Time.

I have trouble reading scientific articles about satellites that mention LEO.

And I've almost said LKO several times when I'm talking about the International Space Station and such.

This game is going to be a pain.
I never have any trouble with Freudian ships.

Freudian slips? I've definitely caught myself a few times calling Mars 'Duna.' One of these days I'm going to post an image of Mars I've taken through my telescope to Facebook or something and say something along the lines of "Hey guys, look at my awesome picture of Duna!"

As for Fruedian 'ships,' I'm honestly afraid of posting a picture of my first Mun lander
